title: What are the issues around deportation? | Explained
content: Why is there a distinction to be made between people who are being deported and those who are being pushed back? What are the different laws that deal with immigration and foreigners in India? What is the situation on the ground in border States such as Assam and West Bengal?

title: India slams Pakistan for seeking to blame it for attack in Waziristan
content: We reject this statement with the contempt it deserves, says Ministry of External Affairs in a statement

title: Seven PWD officials suspended, enquiry against one retired official over Bhopal’s near 90-degree turn bridge
content: A construction agency and the design consultant, hired for the job, have also been blacklisted for giving a “faulty design” for the project, says Chief Minister Mohan Yadav

title: TMC condemns Kalyan Banerjee’s comments on Kolkata law college rape
content: Facing flak for his remarks Mr. Banerjee hit back at his own party saying that leaders who joined party after 2011 are responsible for such crimes.

title: BRS extends support to ‘Chalo Secretariat’ protest march planned by unemployed youth
content: Party leader T. Harish Rao accuses govt. of betraying youth, student communities, and demands white paper on jobs filled

title: BRS spreading false propaganda on safety of Jurala and Manjeera projects, says Irrigation Minister
content: Chief Minister sanctioned ₹100 crore for an alternative bridge to protect Jurala, says Uttam Kumar Reddy

title: DYFI leaders demand immediate release of job calendar
content: Though the previous government had issued 18 notifications through the A.P. Public Service Commission, recruitments were pending on account of legal tangles, say leaders

title: A.P. Waqf Board plans to support poor Muslims through P4 initiative
content: Rent Review Committee will be formed at the State level to review the rents of 1,300 shops directly managed by the board in various areas, says Waqf Board Chairman

title: Former IAS officer M.S. Ramesh passes away at 90
content: Belonging to the 1958 batch, she has served in positions including Joint Secretary in the Finance and Industries Departments and Chairperson of the Tamil Nadu Corporation for Development of Women Limited

title: Punjab government to enact law imposing harsher punishment for sacrilege of religious scriptures, say CM
content: CM Bhagwant Mann says this process will be completed shortly to assuage the sentiments of the public and very soon a Cabinet meeting will be convened on the issue

title: Centre has sanctioned projects worth ₹1,156.15 crore to Tamil Nadu, says Fisheries Ministry
content: In a statement, the Department of Fisheries under the Ministry said an additional fund of ₹262.42 crore was released for implementation of Blue Revolution Scheme (during 2017-18) to Tamil Nadu for implementation of the projects approved under PMMSY.

title: West Bengal CPI(M) leaders meet family of girl killed in Kaliganj bomb explosion
content: The police arrested four more persons in connection with the crude bomb explosion that killed Tammana Khatun, 9, on June 23; among those arrested is a local Trinamool Congress leader, Gawal Sheikh

title: L-G Sinha reviews arrangements for Amarnath Yatra with stakeholders
content: Civil society members, religious leaders, political representatives assure full support for smooth conduct of annual pilgrimage

title: NHL draft tracker: Picks, scouting notes and team fits
content: Day 2 of the 2025 NHL draft is underway (live on ESPN+). Here's a list of every selection, including detailed analysis of Round 1.

title: Sources: Bulls trading Ball to Cavs for Okoro
content: The Chicago Bulls are trading Lonzo Ball to the Cleveland Cavaliers for Isaac Okoro, sources told ESPN.

title: Sources: Dubs tender qualifying offer to Kuminga
content: The Golden State Warriors officially tendered Jonathan Kuminga a $7.9 million qualifying offer which will make the forward a restricted free agent as expected, sources confirmed.

title: Wings' Bueckers out vs. Mystics with knee issue
content: Dallas Wings star rookie Paige Bueckers has been ruled out of Saturday night's home game against the Washington Mystics due to a right knee issue.

title: Ducks send Gibson to Detroit for Mrazek, picks
content: The Ducks traded goalie John Gibson to the Red Wings on Saturday in return for goaltender Petr Mrazek and a pair of future draft picks.

title: Gauff on criticism of Sabalenka: Went 'too far'
content: Coco Gauff said Saturday she didn't want to "fuel hate," and Aryna Sabalenka said the two players were "good" as they want to move past Sabalenka's post-French Open comments that led to backlash.

title: Djokovic: Wimbledon best shot for 25th Slam
content: Novak Djokovic wouldn't confirm if this could be the last Wimbledon of his career, but he did agree it might be his best remaining shot for a record 25th Grand Slam title.

title: Club WC sees 1M empty seats in group stage
content: The Club World Cup group stage saw a million empty seats in the stands over the 48 games in the tournament so far.

title: No. 1 Sinner downplays split with trainer, physio
content: World No. 1 Jannik Sinner said he "feels ready" for Wimbledon despite splitting with his trainer and physio ahead of the  grass-court Grand Slam.

title: 🏀 2026 NBA mock draft: Four top prospects
content: There's considerable excitement around next year's draft class thanks to four players vying for the top spot.

title: Breaking down the best and worst of the NBA draft
content: Who was the steal of the draft? Which teams made risky moves? Our experts share their postdraft superlatives.

title: What we're hearing about Luka, LeBron and the Lakers' offseason
content: After a disappointing first-round playoff flameout, here's an early look at the Lakers' top priorities and targets over the next few weeks.

title: No boxing, no love: Which version of Chavez Jr. shows up against Paul?
content: The 39-year-old risks the possibility of further damaging the credibility of the last name made famous by his father, Julio Sr.

title: Chavez? Tyson? Canelo? Inside the process to pick a Jake Paul opponent
content: Jake Paul discusses his team and other matchmakers to explain the challenges of finding the right matchup.

title: Paige Bueckers meets 'favorite player' Kyrie Irving after historic performance
content: The Dallas Wings star called the moment surreal as she posed with Kyrie Irving and signed a jersey for him.

title: Best power half-seasons ever: Where Cal Raleigh and Aaron Judge rank -- and whether they can keep it up
content: Two AL hitters are crushing long balls at a historic rate. Before their 81st games, we compare their first-half performances to the best ever -- and whether they can keep it going.

title: Power Rankings: A new No. 1 and a top-5 debut
content: The Mets falling as their slump continues and the Astros notching their highest ranking of the season.

title: Wetzel: Please don't expand NCAA basketball tournaments
content: The NCAA will risk an iconic slice of Americana if it expands the NCAA men's and women's tournaments again.

title: Club World Cup is proof of concept that bigger, global tournament can work
content: The Club World Cup needs work, yes, but we've got a strong proof of concept. The games have been competitive, the atmosphere has been building, and the gap between Europe and the rest of the world is smaller than we thought.

title: Wrexham coach: Mullin made decision to leave
content: Wrexham coach Phil Parkinson has told ESPN that Paul Mullin's loan move to Wigan was the player's decision.

title: Spain's Bonmati hospitalized with viral meningitis
content: Two-time Ballon d'Or winner and Spain national team star Aitana Bonmatí has been hospitalized with viral meningitis just six days before the start of the Euro 2025.

title: Sources: Brentford reject Man Utd's Mbeumo bid
content: Brentford have rejected an overall package worth £62.5 million ($85.7 million) for Bryan Mbeumo from Manchester United, sources told ESPN.

title: Madrid's Alaba out of CWC after injury setback
content: Real Madrid defender David Alaba will miss the remainder of the Club World Cup due to a new injury, extending his sidelined time this season after a knee injury.

title: Sources: USMNT's Agyemang close to Derby move
content: Charlotte FC and USMNT striker Patrick Agyemang is closing in on a transfer to Derby County for a fee of $7 million, sources confirmed to ESPN.

title: Sources: USMNT's Weah rejects Forest deal
content: Nottingham Forest have ended their interest in Tim Weah after the United States striker rejected the club's contract proposal, sources told ESPN.

title: Guardiola: Grealish omission not due to behavior
content: Pep Guardiola has rejected the suggestion that Jack Grealish's omission from the Manchester City squad has anything to do with his off-field behaviour.

title: Sources: Giroud to join Lille as LAFC confirms exit
content: Olivier Giroud will join French club Lille this summer, sources have told ESPN, after LAFC confirmed it had agreed to terminate the French striker's contract.

title: What's ahead in 2025 for Notre Dame, UConn and the Pac-2?
content: Could the Irish make another CFP run? Could UConn build on a breakthrough season? We break down what 2025 looks like.

title: Ravens' Kyle Hamilton reveals engagement to longtime girlfriend on Instagram
content: The Baltimore Ravens safety and Reese Damm, his now-fiancée, have been dating since high school and announced their engagement via a shared Instagram post.

title: Top draft picks to watch for your fantasy team
content: After the NHL Draft, here are the players to draft next year, to stash in keeper leagues, or to keep an eye on.

title: PLL Power Rankings: Cannons the new No. 1
content: Margins are tight this season, but one club has risen to the top. Where do the rest land in the rankings?

title: A weird, wonderful night with Ryans, the Rockies and an unlikely world-record attempt
content: What happens when hundreds of Ryans -- no Bryans allowed! -- descend on Coors Field in the hopes of making history? Delightful chaos.﻿

title: Complete draft order of picks for every round
content: When does your favorite team pick in every round of the draft? Here's a pick-by-pick look at all 20 rounds.

title: What we're hearing in the transfer window: Liverpool turn to Hato; Arsenal to make moves?
content: The summer transfer window is now open, but what are our reporters hearing about deals that could be done? Get the latest every Friday.

title: Women's Euros A-Z: The history of the tournament in 26 facts
content: England won the Women's Euros in 2022 and will attempt to retain it this summer, but before the fun gets started, let's run through the tournament's memorable moments.

title: State check: SportsCenter's 50-in-50 Week 1 quiz
content: How well do you know your state sports trivia? From D.C. to Alabama, we're putting your knowledge to the test.

title: Government should take Opposition leaders into confidence on Trump’s claims of ‘opening up’ India: Congress leader Anand Sharma
content: Mr. Sharma, a former Commerce Minister, says India’s national interests must be protected, and it must continue to uphold a rules-based multilateral trade regime and honour WTO agreements

title: Protests escalate over Kolkata student rape case, BJP State President Sukanta Majumdar detained
content: Senior Trinamool Congress MP Kalyan Banerjee’s comment on the rape incident sparks widespread outrage and criticism; Kolkata Mayor Firhad Hakim denies any official association of the prime accused with the Trinamool Congress

title: Bihar begins Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls; 2.93 crore voters asked to produce proof of birth date and place
content: The last SIR in Bihar was done in 2003; all those whose names were not in the rolls at that time asked to produce documents to prove their eligibility to vote; “serious threat of disenfranchisement,” Opposition says

title: Thiruvananthapuram medical college scrambles for explanation after Urology head’s social media lament
content: Harris Chirakkal’s Facebook post spoke of cancelling a 23-year-old boy’s surgery at the eleventh hour. He cited a lack of equipment required for the procedure at the hospital

title: Secondary pollutants constitute up to third of PM2.5 pollution
content: CREA study flags widespread presence of ammonium sulphate and sulphur dioxide presence in many cities

title: Pinarayi Vijayan defends Minister V. Sivankutty on latter’s walkout from Raj Bhavan
content: Sivankutty merely responded the way a Minister should on seeing a flag and symbol not mandated by the Constitution at an official function, says Pinarayi

title: Congress says the BJP is delaying implementing 27% OBC reservation in Madhya Pradesh
content: The lack of implementation of the quota shows that the BJP is against reservation, said Congress leaders

title: 3.6 magnitude earthquake hits J&K; no reports of loss of life or damage to property
content: The quake hit Jammu and Kashmir at 7:36 p.m. at a latitude of 32.96 degrees north and a longitude of 74.71 degrees east with a depth of nine k.m., officials said.

title: SFI to get new national leadership today
content: SFI leaders allege that Governors are acting like “RSS agents” to intrude into the education sector, pointing to the recent ‘Bharat Mata’ controversy at the Kerala Raj Bhavan as an example

title: There will be no hasty decision on minimum wage hike proposal: Shivakumar
content: The Deputy Chief Minister says he has advised Labour Minister Santosh Lad not to take any immediate decision on the proposal

title: ‘Beyond Tomorrow’ meet moots creative incubator to explore new avenues
content: Stakeholders from various creative sectors turn up for the event that proposed the idea of a creative incubator in the State under KSUM

title: Airport staff passes to be linked to facial technology, vehicle number plates, and FASTags
content: Integration of airport entry passes would help in curbing ‘insider threat’, and ‘digitised standard operating procedures will also lead to smarter and quicker responses to any security concerns,’ the CISF said

title: Private schools in Andhra Pradesh warned against turning down admissions under RTE Act
content: Denial of admissions without valid reason will invite departmental action, says Samagra Shiksha State Project Director Srinivasa Rao; deadline for completing the admissions has been extended to July 2

title: Local MSMEs emerging as global contenders, says Minister
content: The signing of 101 MoUs and business agreements, involving 40 first-time exporters and 38 women entrepreneurs becomes major highlight of the International Reverse Buyer-Seller Meet in Tirupati

title: Chennai-bound Air India flight returns to Mumbai due to ‘burning smell’ in cabin
content: “Air India flight AI 639, operating from Mumbai to Chennai, on Friday, June 27, made a precautionary air-return to Mumbai due to a burning smell in the cabin,” the airline said in a statement

title: 300-bed polytrauma centre at NIMHANS north campus in Bengaluru
content: This will be the second polytrauma centre in India, after the Jayaprakash Narayan Apex Trauma Centre at AIIMS, New Delhi

title: Three arrested on charge of committing irregularities in issuance of e-stamps in Andhra Pradesh
content: Police seize three mobile phones, three CPUs, three monitors, printers, laptop, 88 empty e-stamps and other documents from their possession

title: A.P. govt. urged to set up pharma innovation centre in Srikakulam district
content: Migration of students to other States and countries will decrease if industries, research centres, and laboratories are established in the region, says Pulsus Group CEO

title: Smart and invisible policing helping police prevent crimes, says A.P. Home Minister
content: Vangalapudi Anitha urges women to use mobile phones as weapons for protection and to use ‘Sakthi App’ for their safety during the launch of  ‘Suraksha 360’ initiative

title: Global disruptions to help Indian higher education sector to grow, attract foreign students: QS CEO
content: Employer reputation, employment outcomes and increased research helped Indian institutes to improve their QS ranking

title: Mysuru Dasara will be celebrated for 11 days this year
content: As Vijayadashami falls on Gandhi Jayanti, the Chief Minister has instructed the executive committee that the procession of tableaus should focus on Gandhian values

title: Civil Line Road stands orphaned as KMRL, PWD puts onus of its upkeep on each other
content: While KMRL says it is only doing free patchworks to ease traffic and is neither responsible for nor equipped to maintain the road, the PWD claims it handed over the stretch to KMRL over a year ago when Phase II of the metro work to Infopark began

title: Union Minister reviews implementation of Central schemes in Guntur district
content: 90% work on the Western Bypass between Gollapudi and Chinakakani is complete and the remaining work will be finished by September, says Pemmasani Chandra Sekhar

title: CM inaugurates LuLu Group’s IT Twin Towers in SmartCity Kochi
content: The IT complex, developed with an investment of ₹1,500 crore, comprises two identical towers with 30 floors each

title: AIMIM raises concerns over Election Commission’s special intensive revision of electoral rolls in poll-bound Bihar
content: AIMIM president expressed concern that the proposed SIR could have a “deleterious effect” and disenfranchise voters ahead of the elections to the Bihar Assembly

title: Andhra Pradesh Medical Council launches district-level registration services in Tirupati
content: Senior citizens and other doctors facing difficulties to come all the way to Vijayawada for certificates and registration services, says APMC Chairman

title: Andhra Pradesh’s ‘free bus ride for women’ should set a benchmark, says Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu
content: He suggests officials to ensure adequate availability of buses, keeping in view the likely surge in occupancy after its scheduled launch on August 15

title: Traders along Civil Line Road to launch protest
content: A majority of shops risk closure if the situation persists. The condition is worse than what the trading community along MG Road faced during the metro work, says traders forum

title: ‘Misogyny cuts...’: Mahua Moitra reacts as TMC distances from Kalyan, Mitra remarks
content: Trinamool Congress MP Mahua Moitra has openly criticized her party colleagues, Kalyan Banerjee and Madan Mitra, for their controversial remarks regarding the Kolkata law college gang-rape case, emphasizing that misogyny transcends party lines in India. The AITC swiftly disassociated itself from the leaders' comments, condemning them strongly.

title: Win for Trump in SC: Indian families lose shield - citizenship fight gets personal
content: In a 6-3 decision, the US Supreme Court partially upheld President Trump's executive order on birthright citizenship, restricting federal judges' ability to issue nationwide injunctions. While the EO's constitutionality remains under review, the ruling's impact extends beyond birthright citizenship, potentially overwhelming courts with individual lawsuits.

title: Kolkata rape accused was ousted from college TMC unit in 2021; got seat despite limit
content: Manojit Mishra, accused in a law college rape case, is estranged from his father, who emphasizes accountability if his son is guilty. Mishra, once a promising law student, became involved in campus politics, facing allegations of rowdyism and misconduct.

title: 41 years after Rakesh Sharma's 'saare jahan se acha', Shubhanshu Shukla calls India ...
content: In a historic moment, Axiom-4 pilot Shubhanshu Shukla echoed Rakesh Sharma's sentiments from space, declaring India "truly majestic." Interacting with PM Modi from the ISS, Shukla emphasized "oneness" and "Unity in Diversity," highlighting the absence of borders from space.

title: OpenAI CEO takes one of the biggest AI U-Turn; says: Current computers are …
content: Sam Altman has shifted his stance on AI hardware, now believing new devices are essential as AI evolves, contrasting his previous view. He envisions AI systems deeply integrated into users' lives, moving beyond traditional interfaces. This change aligns with Jony Ive's arrival at OpenAI, sparking speculation about a groundbreaking AI device slated for release in late 2026.

title: 'Rape would not have happened if ... ': After Kalyan Banerjee, Madan Mitra stirs row
content: TMC leader Madan Mitra sparked outrage by seemingly blaming the victim in the Kolkata law college gang-rape case, suggesting she shouldn't have gone to the college when it was closed. His remarks drew strong condemnation amid public anger over the incident, which has triggered political backlash and comparisons to past failures. Opposition parties demand accountability and justice.

title: Big cheer for NRIs! Trump’s ‘One Big Beautiful Bill’ reduces remittance tax to 1%
content: The final draft of the 'One Big Beautiful Bill Act' proposes a lower 1% tax on remittances. An earlier version suggested 3.5%. The United States is India's biggest remittance source.

title: US immigration authority to Visa applicants: Effective July 1, 2025, USCIS will no longer send ...
content: USCIS is changing its text message number to 872466 (USAIMM) from July 1, 2025, to help users easily identify official communications. Applicants should save the new number to avoid confusion.

title: Massive record! Smriti Mandhana creates history with century in all three formats
content: Smriti Mandhana made history on Saturday. She became the first Indian woman cricketer to score centuries in all formats. This happened during the T20I against England Women. Mandhana scored 112 runs off 62 balls. India Women posted 210/5, their highest T20I score against England. Her achievement places her among the elite cricketers globally.

title: Burning smell in cabin: Air India flight makes emergency landing in Mumbai
content: An Air India flight to Chennai made an emergency landing in Mumbai. The reason was a burning smell in the cockpit. Another Air India Express flight from Delhi to Jammu returned due to a technical problem. An alternative aircraft was arranged for the Delhi-Jammu passengers. These incidents follow the recent Air India-171 flight crash in Ahmedabad.

title: Historic! Pretorius breaks Miandad's 48-year-old record, becomes youngest to ...
content: South Africa's Lhuan-dre Pretorius, a 19-year-old debutant, etched his name in Test cricket history by becoming the youngest player to score 150 runs in an innings against Zimbabwe, surpassing Javed Miandad's 48-year-old record. Pretorius's counterattacking 153, along with Dewald Brevis's quickfire 51, helped South Africa recover from a shaky start.

title: SoftBank founder’s prediction: Bets billions on AI company; says it will be world's most valuable
content: SoftBank is heavily investing in OpenAI, with planned investments of $33.2 billion, as CEO Masayoshi Son envisions OpenAI becoming the world's most valuable company and a leader in artificial superintelligence. Despite Microsoft's changing relationship with OpenAI, SoftBank remains committed to supporting the AI firm's growth and its role in SoftBank's vision for the future.

title: Pakistan floods: Family stranded mid-river pleading for help; watch video
content: Tragedy struck Pakistan's Swat River as a flash flood swept away a family on a leisure trip, resulting in at least nine fatalities, including children. The victims were caught off guard by the sudden surge in water levels due to heavy upstream rains.

title: Russia plane crash: Training aircraft crashes after engine failure; 4 dead
content: A Yakovlev Yak-18T training aircraft crashed in the Kolomna district of Russia's Moscow region on Saturday, resulting in the deaths of all four occupants, including the crew and trainees. The aircraft experienced engine failure during an aerobatic manoeuvre and crashed in a field, igniting upon impact. An investigation has been launched by the Prosecutor's Office into the incident.

title: 'If there are issues ... ': Tharoor reacts to his cryptic bird post- watch
content: Shashi Tharoor addressed speculation about his strained relationship with the Congress party, stating any issues would be discussed privately. This follows cryptic social media posts and remarks praising PM Modi's diplomacy, which drew criticism from within the party. Congress leaders indirectly rebuked Tharoor, questioning his loyalty, while Tharoor maintained his comments reflected national interest.

title: Blake Lively stops Swift from cutting her off as Kelce backs Taylor quietly
content: Blake Lively is reportedly struggling to salvage her friendship with Taylor Swift amidst the fallout from her legal issues with Justin Baldoni. As Travis Kelce distances himself from Ryan Reynolds, Lively is allegedly making desperate attempts to reconcile with Swift, even enlisting mutual friends for assistance. However, Swift's inner circle seems to be siding with her, leaving Lively's efforts uncertain.

title: 'Gajar ka Halwa' in zero gravity: PM Modi shares a laugh with Shubhanshu Shukla during space call
content: PM Modi engaged in a cheerful video call with Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla, India's newest space traveller, congratulating him on his historic achievement. Shukla shared that he brought 'gajar ka halwa', 'moong dal ka halwa', and 'aam ras' to share India's culinary heritage with his international teammates, who thoroughly enjoyed the treats.

title: Russell Wilson’s wife in dance tribute for La La Anthony, honors Kobe Bryant & Michael Jordan
content: Ciara Princess Wilson celebrated her best friend La La Anthony's birthday with a stylish video, captivating fans from the NFL and NBA. The singer also shared moments from Fanatics Fest, including a heartfelt tribute to basketball legends Michael Jordan and Kobe Bryant, highlighting her connections within the sports world and her enduring friendships.

title: Cues from Birmingham nets: Bumrah keeps everyone guessing, Kuldeep gives it a rip!
content: Jasprit Bumrah displayed intense focus during practice at Edgbaston, bowling with pace and accuracy alongside Mohammed Siraj and Prasidh Krishna. Kuldeep Yadav is also working diligently on both his bowling and batting, potentially becoming a key option for the second Test given Birmingham's dry conditions. The team will now take a break before regrouping, with Bumrah's availability remaining uncertain.

title: Noida horror: Surprise check at old age home reveals harsh truths- locked, lonely, forgotten
content: An 80-year-old man, MG Singh, alleges mistreatment at a private old age home in Noida, claiming confinement and inadequate care. Following an inspection, the UP women's commission exposed troubling conditions at Anand Niketan. Staff admitted to using restraints on inmates, citing mental health issues and understaffing.

title: 'Secularism goes against Indian idea': Himanta backs call to remove words from Preamble
content: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma advocated for removing "secularism" and "socialism" from the Constitution's Preamble, echoing RSS's suggestion. He believes these terms, added during the Emergency, contradict India's principles of Sarva Dharma Sambhava and its economic vision. Sarma urged the government to eliminate these words, viewing them as legacies of the Emergency that Prime Minister Modi is working to erase.

title: 'Furthest from motherland, closest to Indian hearts': PM interacts with Shubhanshu Shukla
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi virtually interacted with astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla on the ISS, congratulating him on behalf of India. Shukla expressed gratitude, highlighting the opportunities provided under Modi's leadership. He shared his experience of viewing Earth from space, emphasizing its unity and the absence of borders. Shukla also carried Indian desserts to share with his international crewmates.

title: 'Explosive-laden vehicle hit convoy': 16 Pakistan troops killed in suicide attack
content: A suicide attack, claimed by the Pakistani Taliban, targeted a military convoy in North Waziristan, resulting in the deaths of 16 soldiers and injuries to over two dozen individuals, including civilians. The bomber used an explosive-laden vehicle, causing significant damage and casualties.

title: Train control systems set for big upgrade! Railways prepares new blueprint
content: Indian Railways is set to overhaul its century-old train control systems, prioritizing safety and efficiency. The Railway Board plans to establish integrated command centers, replacing manual systems with advanced technology for better traffic management and crisis response.

title: Iyer not in Test contention yet, says ex-India cricketer: 'His time will come'
content: Despite Shreyas Iyer's impressive performances in the ICC Champions Trophy, IPL, and domestic red-ball season, Aakash Chopra suggests a Test call-up isn't imminent. Chopra highlights that players like Karun Nair, Sarfaraz Khan, and Dhruv Jurel are ahead in the queue.

title: Watch: PM Modi's ‘Jo humein chhedega’ remark draws loud applause at Jain event
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi sparked excitement at a spiritual event by alluding to "Operation Sindoor," drawing cheers from the audience. He praised Acharya Vidyanand Maharaj Ji's contributions to Jain philosophy and highlighted the government's welfare policies inspired by spiritual figures. Modi also emphasized the promotion of mother tongues like Prakrit and the digitization of ancient Jain manuscripts.

title: India to welcome Pakistan; rivals placed in Pool B of Junior Men's Hockey World Cup
content: India is set to host the FIH Hockey Men's Junior World Cup in Chennai and Madurai from November 28 to December 10. The host nation finds itself in Pool B, facing Pakistan, Chile, and Switzerland. This edition marks a historic moment as the tournament expands to include 24 teams for the first time.

title: Watch: Paris hit by deadly thunderstorms; floodwaters rise near Eiffel Tower
content: Paris has been hit by severe thunderstorms and heavy rain since Wednesday, causing widespread flooding and damage. A viral video showed the Eiffel Tower illuminated amidst floodwaters as people sought shelter. Tragically, a 12-year-old boy and a 59-year-old motorcyclist died due to the storm's impact, with emergency responders handling over 300 calls and conducting numerous rescues.

title: ‘Orange alert’: Light rain brings relief to Delhi-NCR; IMD warns of thunderstorms
content: Delhi NCR experienced light rainfall on Saturday, bringing respite from the heat. The IMD has issued an orange alert, predicting thunderstorms and gusty winds with speeds of 30 to 50 kmph in the coming hours. While the minimum temperature was slightly above average, air quality remained in the 'satisfactory' category.

title: 'Totally pointless': Dutch no. 1 Giri reacts after Pragg becomes world no. 1 junior player
content: Anish Giri's witty remark on Praggnanandhaa becoming the World No.1 junior highlights the rise of young chess talents. Praggnanandhaa's UzChess Cup Masters 2025 victory, propelling him to World No.4 and India's top player, showcases his dominance. His dramatic win, praised by Viswanathan Anand, underscores his impressive character and solidifies his position as a leading force in chess.

title: Kolkata law college gangrape: Sukanta Majumdar detained during protest
content: West Bengal BJP president Sukanta Majumdar was detained by police during a protest against an alleged gangrape at South Calcutta Law College. Majumdar criticized Mamata Banerjee's government for failing to ensure student safety following multiple crime reports from educational institutions, including the RG Kar Medical College rape case. He asserted the government's inability to maintain a safe environment disqualifies their right to govern.

title: Justin Bieber’s baby Jack melts hearts in Toronto Maple Leafs Jersey
content: Justin Bieber delighted fans by sharing photos of his son, Jack Blues Bieber, wearing an Auston Matthews Toronto Maple Leafs jersey. The images quickly went viral, with the team's official Instagram account showing their support. Bieber, a longtime celebrity fan of the Leafs, is passing on his passion for hockey to the next generation, creating a heartwarming moment for fans.

title: UP shocker: Navy personnel rapes woman after drugging her; filmed act
content: A Navy personnel in Kanpur has been accused of drugging and raping a woman under the false pretense of marriage. The accused, a friend of the victim's brother, allegedly took obscene photos and videos of her and threatened to release them when she insisted on marriage.

title: From cricket to Centre Court: How Wimbledon plans on wooing India
content: Wimbledon is targeting India to grow its brand, tapping into cricket’s popularity and engaging young audiences through collaborations, influencers, and technology. Indian cricketers like Virat Kohli, Sachin Tendulkar, and Rohit Sharma have become key figures in this strategy. With key partnerships, Wimbledon aims to blend tradition with innovation for global appeal.

title: Tatas suspend 4 after Air India SATS party video sparks outrage
content: Tata Group took swift disciplinary action, suspending four senior officials from Air India SATS and warning others, after a video surfaced showing executives partying shortly after the tragic June 12 Air India flight 171 crash. The celebration, held at the Gurugram office on June 20, sparked public outrage, with over 3.

title: Telangana tragedy: 6-year-old comes under tipper as mom tries to overtake from left
content: In Dundigal, a tragic accident occurred when a six-year-old boy, Abhimanyu Reddy, died after falling under a tipper truck while his mother, Niharika, was trying to overtake it on a scooter. Niharika lost control of the scooter, causing Abhimanyu to fall onto the road and under the vehicle's rear wheel.

title: Bihar shocker: Another wife kills husband with help of lover; runs Scorpio SUV over him
content: In Bihar's Aurangabad, a woman named Puja has been arrested for allegedly plotting with her lover, Kamlesh Yadav, to murder her husband, Bikku. Puja lured Bikku with the false promise of seeking medicine in Gayaji.

title: Former Manipur CM Biren Singh says efforts under way to form popular govt
content: Former Manipur CM N. Biren Singh stated that efforts are underway to establish a popular government in the state, emphasizing the BJP's commitment to restoring peace. He expressed optimism about forming a new government soon, highlighting the party's focus on resolving the ongoing crisis through collaboration with the central government and MLAs. Singh noted the absence of inter-community fighting in recent months, underscoring the importance of peace.

title: 'No matter who's around' - Prasidh Krishna on Bumrah's absence
content: India faced a setback in the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy's first Test against England, with coach Gautam Gambhir committed to managing Jasprit Bumrah's workload, limiting him to three matches. Prasidh Krishna sees this as an opportunity, emphasizing team unity and learning from senior players like Bumrah.

title: Kolkata rape case: BJP forms committee; slams TMC for 'state-sponsored brutality'
content: BJP criticized the TMC government following a reported gangrape at a Kolkata law college, alleging the main accused's connection to TMC. Sambit Patra claimed the incident appeared state-sponsored due to the accused's TMC affiliation. BJP President JP Nadda formed a committee, including Satpal Singh and Meenakshi Lekhi, to investigate the matter and submit a report.

title: A'ja Wilson, Josh Allen among 2025 ESPYS candidates; vote now
content: the 2025 ESPYS presented by Capital One are July 16 . the Oklahoma City Thunder guard is nominated in two categories: Best Athlete - Men's Sports, and Best NBA Player . Simone Biles and Sydney McLaughlin-Levrone are up for best . Ilona Maher and Ezra Frech represent in both categories .

title: How busy will your team be this summer? We tiered all 30 ahead of free agency
content: teams across the league are shifting focus to the free agency and trade landscape . how many teams have salary cap space, and which could create some? who could follow the Boston Celtics and make cost-cutting trades to save on their luxury tax bill?

title: Yankees announce George Costanza bobblehead giveaway for Aug. 21
content: the first 18,000 fans at the Yankees' matchup against the Boston Red Sox will receive a bobblehead of George Costanza sleeping under his desk . it coincides with "Seinfeld Night" at Yankee Stadium .

title: Can Ilia Topuria do everything left on his UFC to-do list by 30?
content: Ilia Topuria reveals his future fight plans if he beats Charles Oliveira for the vacant lightweight title . the 28-year-old will look to become a two-weight champion on saturday . topuria said retirement comments from December were heavily influenced by the drastic amount of weight he had to cut to make the featherweight limit .

title: Mock drafts, rankings, order, analysis and more
content: the 2025 draft is set for July 13-14 in Atlanta, Georgia . the first round begins at 6 p.m. ET and will be broadcast live on ESPN and MLB Network . coverage of day 2 of the draft will be streamed on MLB.com beginning at 11:30 a.m .

title: McCullers set to return, Diamondbacks still dealing with injuries
content: fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around MLB . a dozen matinees get going at 1:05 p.m. ET, with another early tilt starting five minutes later . the Arizona Diamondbacks are already missing OF Corbin Carroll and C Gabriel Moreno and will probably take on the Miami Marlins this afternoon .

title: Mizoram May Seize IDs Of Refugees Who Often Cross Border To And From Myanmar
content: The Mizoram government is considering confiscating the identity cards of Myanmar refugees who repeatedly cross the international border to and from the neighbouring country, an official said on Friday.

title: 'Shielding Criminals?' Trinamool Raps MP Over Rape Remark, He Claps Back
content: The Trinamool Congress, facing a relentless attack from the BJP over the links of the main accused in the Kolkata law student rape case to its student wing, found itself sinking deeper into a quagmire on Saturday.

title: "Why Did She Go There?" Trinamool MLA's Shocker On Kolkata Law Student's Rape
content: Adding fuel to the raging fire that his party is fighting after the rape of a law student in Kolkata, Trinamool Congress MLA Madan Mitra appeared to apportion at least a part of the blame to the woman herself.

title: Kerala Boy, 5, Bitten By Stray Dog Last Month, Dies Despite Being Vaccinated
content: A five-year-old boy who was bitten by a stray dog last month died at the Pariyaram Medical College Hospital here on Saturday despite being vaccinated.

title: Religious Sites In Mumbai Now "Loudspeaker-Free": Top Cop
content: Mumbai Police Commissioner Deven Bharti on Saturday asserted that the city is now entirely free of directional loudspeakers after its personnel successfully completed a comprehensive crackdown on public address systems.

title: Washington Post Journalist Thomas LeGro Arrested For Possessing Child Porn
content: The 48-year-old Washington Post reporter made his first appearance in the United States District Court on Friday in connection with the case.

title: Delhi To See Its First-Ever Artificial Rain To Combat Air Pollution In July
content: In a first for the national capital, Delhi is set to witness artificial rain aimed at reducing air pollution, with cloud seeding scheduled between July 4 and 11, subject to weather conditions, Delhi Environment Minister Manjinder Singh Sirsa said.

title: Uttarakhand BJP Expels Ex-MLA From Party Over Alleged Second Marriage
content: The ruling BJP in Uttarakhand expelled former MLA Suresh Rathore from the party for six years on Saturday following a controversy over his alleged second marriage.

title: Meitei Civil Groups From Manipur To Hold Talks With Centre In Delhi On Monday
content: A delegation of civil society organisations of the Meitei community in Manipur will hold talks with the Ministry of Home Affairs in Delhi on June 30 over the current situation in the ethnic strife-torn state, officials said on Saturday.

title: Heavy Rains In Kerala, Weather Office Issues Orange Alert In 7 Districts
content: As heavy rains lashed various parts of Kerala, water in many rivers rose to dangerous levels prompting evacuation of hundreds of people living in low-lying areas and riverbanks.

title: Bridge With 90-Degree Angle: Madhya Pradesh Government Takes Action Against 8 Engineers
content: The Madhya Pradesh government on Saturday suspended seven engineers including two chief engineers of the Public Works Department for the faulty design of the new Rail Over Bridge in Aishbagh area of the city with an unusual 90-degree turn.

title: Himanta Sarma Launches 'Emergency Diaries', Calls For Removing 'Secularism, Socialism' From Constitution
content: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma, while addressing the media on Saturday at Vajpayee Bhawan, the state BJP headquarters in Guwahati, launched a book titled 'Emergency Diary'.

title: No Talk Of Change Of Chief Minister By High Command: Siddaramaiah's Son
content: Amid mounting speculation over a potential leadership change in Karnataka, Yathindra Siddaramaiah, son of Chief Minister Siddaramaiah, has strongly dismissed the rumours, asserting that his father has the full backing of the party high command.

title: Iran Extends Access To Airspace For Overflights After Ceasefire
content: Iran has expanded access to its airspace for international overflights following a ceasefire with Israel, though flight restrictions remain in place across much of the country.

title: Stripped, Beaten, Head Shaved: Telangana Woman Missing After Torture Over Adultery
content: A woman in Telangana was tied to a cot, stripped, beaten, and her head was shaved after she was accused of adultery.

title: Government Extends Top Tax Authority CBDT Chairman's Tenure By A Year
content: The government has extended the tenure of Ravi Agrawal as the Chairman of the Central Board of Direct Taxes (CBDT) by another year.

title: "Preamble Not Alterable, But Bharat's Was Changed. Why?": Jagdeep Dhankhar
content: Jagdeep Dhankhar delivered a poignant critique of the changes made to the Preamble of the Indian Constitution during the Emergency period in 1975, describing it as a betrayal of the document's "Soul" and the vision of its framers.

title: Don't Be Surprised If India Repeats Action Upon Provocation: Shashi Tharoor
content: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor on Saturday said foreign countries were told clearly during the post-Operation Sindoor diplomatic outreach that in case of a fresh provocation, India would repeat its action.

title: "India Looks Very Grand, Very Big From Space": Shubhanshu Shukla To PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday spoke to Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla, who is the first Indian astronaut to reach the International Space Station (ISS).

title: "16 Sunsets, 16 Sunrises": Shubhanshu Shukla To PM On Life On ISS
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday spoke to Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla of the Indian Air Force - the man who created history earlier this week by becoming the first Indian to enter the International Space Station (ISS).
